system.description: Almost as shady as the Assassin, a Thief is a bit more socially oriented and has a much greater care for her own life. Thieves are the flip side of the Samurai and tend to follow laws and tell the truth only if it serves their purpose. Always trying to make a profit, thieves are the businessmen of the world and will cheat you without blinking an eyelash, that is their job. If you are playing a thief, lie and make up stories, be ever watchful for a chance to search or loot and look for the profit angle, never doing anything for free.

overview.base: You become hidden. As you do this, you may roll [[/roll 1d20 + @snk]]. If this is greater than your passive sneak ([[/roll 10 + @snk]]), then you use it as your hidden DC. If not, use your passive sneak.
overview.proficient: Instead roll [[/roll 1d20 + @snk + @p]] for your hidden DC (if it's greater than your passive sneak).
overview.fluent: Instead roll [[/roll 1d20 + @snk + @f]] for your hidden DC (if it's greater than your passive sneak).

system.requirements: You are in a location with shadows, dim light, three-quarters cover, or some other feature which the GM determines is appropriate for being hidden. You must remain in areas that maintain these conditions to stay hidden.

overview.base: Choose a standard ability as you use Disable Ray. You must choose the same ability each time you use it, unless at least 10 minutes has passed since the last time you used Disable Ray.

results.hit: Target becomes incapable of the chosen standard ability.

overview.base: Target is glued to the creature bearing it.

system.requirements: Target item must be beared by a creature.

overview.base: Target is no longer glued and you take it.

system.requirements: Target's bearer is down or target it searchable.

overview.base: You are a talented locksmith.
